CatDescriptText: Bloise "Bobby" Avery, waiter, Glen-Hazel and Mike Sheleheda, student, Ambridge, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 15, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe that the Pirates will lose any cash customers in 1961 because of the way the World Series tickets were..."  Mr. Avery's answer reads: " No, I don't believe that it will because the Pirates have a very good team and everybody is behind them all the way."  Mr. Sheleheda's answer reads: "I don't think so, in fact, I think that there will be more people who turn out to see the National League champs."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Bloise "Bobby" Avery wearing tweed suit jacket and hat, standing on Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Mike Sheleheda wearing varsity style jacket, standing on Smithfield Street, Downtown
